title: Token-Level Density-Based Uncertainty Quantification Methods for Eliciting Truthfulness of Large Language Models
author: Artem Vazhentsev (Skoltech), Lyudmila Rvanova (AIRI), Ivan Lazichny (AIRI), Alexander Panchenko (Skoltech), Maxim Panov (MBZUAI), Timothy Baldwin (The University of Melbourne), Artem Shelmanov (MBZUAI)
relevance_why: The methods proposed for uncertainty quantification in language models could potentially enhance audio and speech models by improving the robustness and reliability of generated outputs.
background: The study focuses on improving the reliability of large language models' outputs by implementing token-level uncertainty quantification to detect inaccuracies in generated content.
contribution: This paper introduces a supervised method leveraging Mahalanobis Distance for uncertainty quantification in text generation, greatly improving over existing techniques and achieving enhanced reliability in generated outputs.
technical_comparison: Previous methods primarily relied on external knowledge sources and ensemble models, leading to high computational costs. This work improves by applying a token-level approach to Mahalanobis Distance, reducing computational requirements.
key_innovation: Adapting Mahalanobis Distance for token-level uncertainty quantification in language models while ensuring computational efficiency.
real_world_impact: This method enhances the practical deployment of large language models in safety-critical applications by providing reliable uncertainty estimates, which is crucial for ensuring truthful and accurate outputs.
limitations: The approach is supervised, requiring high-quality annotated data for effective training, which may limit its applicability.

new_terms.Mahalanobis Distance: **Mahalanobis Distance** is a measure of distance between a point and a distribution, accounting for correlations in the data that can be used to identify outliers.
new_terms.uncertainty quantification: **Uncertainty quantification** refers to the process of quantifying and analyzing uncertainty in model predictions, which helps understand the reliability of those predictions.

open_sourcing: The code is available online at https://github.com/ArtemVazh/token_mahalanobis_distance
